column7: 1935 to donald s. and desna (nee lindner) lesher in lewistown
column9: bob attended cleveland heights high school where he graduated with honors and was awarded a women's civic club scholarship. he graduated magna cum laude in 1957 from case institute of technology with a bachelor of science degree in metallurgical engineering. mr. lesher joined cleveland twist drill company after graduation. there
column10: he held several engineering and manufacturing positions. in 1971
column11: he was named manager of the wage standards dept. and in 1975 added the managerial duties of the manufacturing systems dept. mr. lesher served two years in the u. s. air force at wright patterson air force base in research and development. he then earned a postgraduate degree in professional management from john carroll university. bob was an avid golf
column12: tennis and skiing enthusiast. he enjoyed playing platform tennis during the winter months at western reserve academy with friends from walden golf and tennis community. he is survived by his fiancee
column13: patricia schron of hudson; a cousin
column15: n. j.; and extended family of chris (fiancee christine freeman)
column19: jake friedl; and canine companion maddie rose. mr. lesher was a strong supporter of the american cancer society with his time and finances. in lieu of flowers
